Mod: Dekes
Back-up mod: Equinox

===================================================================================

Night fell upon the town of Averagely Suspicious. Not an uncommon event for the town as this had happened on a rather regular basis since the town was founded back in 1766. What made this night a special night was discovered when thirteen citizens met on the town square at the first rays of light. After hearing muffled sounds throughout the night they decided to seek out the cause for these highly irritating disturbances.
And not long after, they realized that every other citizen had been killed during the night. A note was lying next to each victim, leaving the remaining townsmen quite rattled:

"You're next..."

Time to start-a-killin', folks!

Player List:
9. pod person Bill McQuill
10. Barry Allen

* indicates a prod

Dead:

Spoiler:
2. GreyICE, Vanilla Townie, lynched D1
7. Ashblade, Vanilla Townie, killed N1
12. Snake Eyes, Vanilla Townie, killed N1
11. Hiraki, Vanilla Townie, lynched D2
6. RobCapone, Town Tracker, killed N2
13. mozamis Hayker, Mafia Watcher, killed N2
8. AGar penpen wikkiden, Mafia Doc, lynched D3
5. Erratus Apathos, Town Mason, killed N3
1. subgenius, Vanilla Townie, killed N3
3. bvoigt mockingjaye, Vanilla Townie, killed N5
4. Papa Zito, Town Mason, killed N5



End of Day 1
Start of Day 2
End of Day 2

End of Day 3

End of Day 5
Start of Day 6, End game
===================================================================================

Rules:

1. This is still just a game. Play for fun and stay civil.
2. Do not talk about this game outside of this thread.
3. Do not quote any PM's from the mod.
4. Do not use invisible or small text or other methods to deceive the mod.
5. Do not use this color as it is the mod's color.
6. Any violations of these rules can and will lead to a warning and/or modkill.

7. Votes must be formatted in the following fashion: Vote: Player. Unvotes are recommended but not mandatory.
8. It will take the majority to lynch, half of the remaining player list to no lynch. If no majority is reached at deadline, the day will end in a no lynch.
9. After a majority has been reached you may keep talking until the mod posts the lynch scene.
10. Do not post after you die, not even a "bah"-post. All rage must be reserved for the dead topic.
11. The day phase will last two weeks maximum, the night phase 48 hours.

12. If a player hasn't posted in 48 hours they will be prodded. If they won't respond to the prod within 24 hours I will be looking for a replacement. Four prods will lead to an automatic replacement.
13. V/LA's must be bolded in this thread or sent to the mod via PM.

14. Since the mod is only human, feel free to request vote counts and prods if you see the need to. Any other questions regarding the setup should be send via PM.
15. This ruleset may or not be complete so I reserve the right to change it if I see it fit.

Sample Vanilla Townie Role PM
Welcome to Averagely Suspicious Mafia, xxx.

You are a Vanilla Townie.

Abilities:
None

You win when all the threats to the town have been eliminated. Please confirm your role by PM'ing me back.

The game can be found here: http://mafiascum.net/forum/viewtopic.php?f=2&t=16416

Good luck!
Sending out role PMs.
Role PMs have been sent out. Confirmation Stage will approximately last 48 hours. Feel free to use the thread for any pre-game talk. Votes will not count until D1 starts.
Let the festivities begin! o;

PenPen, you're new and you don't read scummy to me, but I want to offer you some advice:

If your gut feels a certain way, then mull it over. Read their posts again. Offer some decent feelings. Guts read the way they do for reasons - and they can be totally right and totally wrong. "gut" is the thing that makes you jump out of the way when someone is coming up behind you - a change in the light, reflections off water and metal, sounds you can barely hear. Gut is the thing that makes you convinced there's someone in the house when it's empty - sounds you can barely hear, changes in light, raw paranoia. You have to learn to filter one from the other.

Use gut as a compass, not a final destination.

Once again the sun rises and Averagely Suspicious is wreathed in mist this morning. An omen for things to come. A lone figure enters the town square. He looks around but everything appears empty. "You know where they are, Barry."
"Indeed I do. So what now? I will not give up this town."
"And the mafia won't either."
"Very well. But there is a third option."
"Is that so?"
Through the thick of the mist pod can see Barry smirking, but Barry doesn't seem to be interested in answering at all.
"What the hell do you want, Barry? The Mafia plans? Do you want to blackmail us? Do you expect me to talk?"
"No, Mr. Pod. I expect you to tie!"

Comments:
So, this was my first modded game and all in all I think I did pretty well for the most part of it.

What went well:
- Activity: Although I had to replace some of the inexperienced players at the beginning, the overall activity was great. Props to all of you!
- Barry Allen: SK is always a tough role to pull of and he went through the game almost unsuspected for the whole time.
- Town play past D2: There was a pretty solid town core (EA, PZ, subgenius) and a pretty solid suspect core (mozamis, AGar, pod), so the townies made themselves very obvious.
- Mason staying hidden for so long. They're a powerful role, especially when it comes to LyLo.

What didn't go well:
- Town play until N2: I believe GreyICE would've been a great asset for the town, but unfortunately he became victim of the random D1 lynch. And it becomes quite apparent again how hard it is to deal with VIs/inexperienced players. Nonetheless I think wikkiden should've gotten a lot more pressure for that glaring contradiction on D1. Very confusing town on the first two days.
- Mason play: Sorry, guys. But you had the scum team already pegged N1. And Hiraki was in your town reads. And you completely let the Hiraki lynch go through on D2 (although Hiraki didn't help his case by doing nothing). You failed to form a vote block that could've pressured the scum more.
- The mafia kill N1: There was a claimed tracker with three scum roles to catch and Papa Zito who had all of you pegged D1 and you go after a moderately townish person? If you can get rid of a town PR N1 you do it, no matter how shady that person looks. Claimed PRs don't get lynched on early days without a cc. Wasted kill.
- End game: Not your fault, but it's not the satisfactory ending I was hoping for.


Regarding the setup:
I don't think the Mafia was overpowered at all if you take into account some things:
- A tracker who claims unprovoked Day 1 is a huge blow for town. He could've tracked all three scum so it'd be in the best interest to stay hidden as long as possible.
- The mafia watcher was basically useless with only one role to catch.
- The mafia doc may be a bit more useful than a town doc, but he is very dangerous for his team if he flips after he has claimed.

I probably would tweak it if I would run it again, but not by much (get rid of the goon/limit the SK in some way).

In the end, the town maybe deserved the win since two mislynches is borderline in a mini and they played overall well for the second part of the game. But as I said in the Dead QT, they got punished for their bad first two days and just weren't lucky enough with cross kills.

Ashblade wrote:Oh, Barry killed me. LOL, no wonder I died.

bvoigt wrote:BTW, what would have been the best way to play in the 1:1:2 endgame?

Well, when pod proposed to lynch PZ, the confirmed town, I wish PZ wouldn't have dismissed it right away. Whoever PZ suspected at that moment, it was obivous that the two remaining scum didn't who each other were. Which would've increased the likelihood of an unintentional cross kill and a subsequent town win by a lot. Of course, there's a lot of inside knowledge mod talk in here, but this seemed to be the best way for town to still have a shot at winning.

I hope you still enjoyed the game as much as I did.

To weigh in on the setup discussion:

- Fact: The more PRs scum have the stronger the town tracker gets. The more PRs town has the stronger the scum watcher gets. So in this case we had a very useful town tracker and a very useless scum watcher.

- If you track a scummy person who claims doc to another scummy person at night, you should be able to put one and one together. And scum doc is a very acceptable role in normal games and therefore should very well be expected.

- Town tracker/watcher combination is very town op in a mini and I'd definitely question such a combo. If there was ever a massclaim in this game and people were to believe town tracker, watcher and masons I'd be very surprised.

Town's have a surprisingly good record in 3:1:8 set-ups;

3:1:8 Closed mini normals (3rd party = SK) (77 games)

Mafia wins: 35 (45.4%)
Town wins: 37 (48.1%)
SK wins: 5 (6.5%)


...Which runs against the grain as far as 12 player games go. In 3:9's for instance, the town win rate was floundering at around 36% - doesn't it seem strange to you in a game with one more scum, the town is producing better results? (Note: I'm using 12 player games here because the sample size for 13 isn't large enough)

The reason is crosskills. In games with additional kills at night, whether they be from a vig or SK, they are producing a higher ratio of non-mafia kills to mafia kills, diluting their influence - mafia no longer get to decide 50% of the kills in the game. This weakened influence with their own NK, coupled with the risk of being picked off at night severely bites into mafia's chances of winning. It's an admittedly swingy mechanism to balance a game, as a small to large piece of the game is out of town's hands, but this is the baggage you need to accept when playing in a multiple scum game. Personally, I prefer not playing in games with two mafia factions or a mafia/SK, for this very reason. It makes the game increasingly chaotic and dependent on what happens with the kills, which isn't fun for me. However, many players and mods like the SK role, so we're going to have to convince them otherwise here.

To speak from a more anecdotal perspective, many 3:1:8's in the past have had similar balances of power; a Bulletproof SK, or maybe a mafia GF with investigation or NK immunity, against 2-3 town powers. I think it's easy to be deceived into thinking the mafia was overpowered this game, because they have two PR's. But lets look at what they actually do; the Doctor - he offers protection to one mafia member out of three. This is only useful against the SK, and unlike being a NK-immune GF, the scumteam can lose this power by the Doc being NK'ed (or lynched). The Watcher for mafia does very little this game - it can only catch one town PR, and the SK is immune to it. The reason for masons existing in the game, is so town have a small core of power that isn't able to be manipulated by scum's powers.

I think it's also important to remember, with 3:1:8's producing relatively even contests (despite being swingy), we're now adding in an extra townie, which should be another town benefit. I think it's easy to look at the set-up and scan the roles, and go, "hang on, 3 town PR's against 4 scum? That isn't right!" But crosskills are a particularly fickle mechanic that rip through the heart of a scum team as easily as it can obliterate town, and it's kind of sucky that this mechanic is what plays a big part in determining the outcome of Mafia/SK games - it's probably that feeling that you don't have much control over the outcome as a townie that makes it appear unbalanced. But that is the nature of the beast!

I don't really understand this post. Are you talking about 3:1:8's or 3:1:9's? One of the reasons why we upgraded to 13 players over 12 was to better balance two core set-ups; 3:9 --> 3:10 and 3:1:8 --> 3:1:9. The SK is a particularly awkward role to balance in Minis, without making the game swingy. Because by nature, the very inclusion of two killing forces at night is going to produce a swingy game, where crosskills are crucial.
